lead_paragraph: The journalists have been jailed since a failed coup in July, and news outlets have been closed or taken over by supporters of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.print_headline: Turkey’s Free Press Withers as Erdogan Jails 120 Journalists
headline.main: Turkey’s Free Press Withers as Erdogan Jails 120 Journalists

snippet: The journalists have been jailed since a failed coup in July, and news outlets have been closed or taken over by supporters of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan....
abstract: Turkey eviscerates its free press, having detained 120 journalists since failed military coup granted Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan broad emergency powers he has used in crackdown on free speech; remaining pro-government press, widely considered to be regime's mouthpiece, revels in its position of influence.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
